meanings.definition: To decide or announce that a planned event will not take place
meanings.sent1: She is canceling the party due to bad weather.
meanings.sent2: The airline is canceling flights because of a strike.
meanings.sent3: Canceling the picnic might upset some friends, but safety comes first.
meanings.sent4: His apology canceled out the hurt feelings from the argument.
meanings.sent5: The storm canceled the outdoor concert, leaving disappointed fans.

meanings.definition: To delete or remove something from a list or schedule
meanings.sent1: I am canceling my subscription to the magazine.
meanings.sent2: The teacher is canceling the assignment for tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: Canceling the unnecessary meeting saved everyone time.
meanings.sent4: Her smile canceled out the negative comments about her work.
meanings.sent5: The eraser canceled the mistake on the paper, making it look perfect.

meanings.definition: To neutralize the effect of something by taking opposite action
meanings.sent1: Eating something sweet can help cancel out the bitter taste.
meanings.sent2: Exercising can cancel out the calories from the dessert.
meanings.sent3: His loud singing canceled out the quiet atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness canceled out the negativity in the room.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors canceled out the dullness of the room, making it lively.
